title: Strictly's Dianne 'stunned' judges voted Dev off as he did 'exactly what they said'
text:
Get the biggest Strictly Come Dancing stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Strictly Come Dancing's Dianne has admitted she's still reeling from the judge's bombshell decision to evict her and partner Dev Griffin from the show this weekend.

Speaking in her first interview since their shock elimination, Dianne said she promised Dev he was 'going to be fine' because of the judges comments to them earlier in the night.

Both Craig Revel Horwood and head judge Shirley Ballas had initially expressed their complete surprise at Dev even being in the bottom two.

While all four judges heaped praise on the DJ's red-themed Cha Cha on Saturday night.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

(Image: DIGITAL/EROTEME.CO.UK)

Speaking of her continued confusion on It Takes Two, Dianne said: "They gave us great comments. They said the dancing was great. It was just that they wanted him to be a little bit more cheeky in that cha cha.

"I feel like Dev went out there and did exactly what they said."

Dev added that he also felt like he'd given the second performance his all.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: BBC)

But sadly it wasn't enough for the judges who unanimously voted to save Viscountess Weymouth and Aljaz Skorjanec.

Dianne was so upset by the decision she couldn't complete the obligatory final dance and pulled out of appearing on the show's podcast with her boyfriend Joe Sugg after filming wrapped.

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

(Image: PA)

But the red-head said she hopes it's not over for Dev and she'll continue teaching him if he wants to continue to learn to dance.

"I'm just really, really sad it's over," Dianne told Rylan Clark-Neal.

Radio 1 DJ Dev also said that he was shocked by the judges' final say as he had given it is all in the dance-off.

"I feel like I really, really went for it and tried to give it everything ... I guess it wasn't enough."

(Image: ITV)

Viewers have also been expressing their shock at the couple's early eviction.

Some have even accused the show of 'fixing' the results by claiming they could not get through when they tried to vote for Dev on Saturday night.

While others said they may not tune in again after claiming the judges got it wrong.

Shirley Ballas appeared on Monday's Loose Women where she opened up about the situation.

She said that she voting public were also responsible for Dev's demise.

(Image: ITV)

"People have got to get out there and vote. we do our job. As you can see there were many people saved with lot lower scores.

"It's just so important...I respect everybody at home who’s been watching fifteen series. Everyone has a favourite. We do our job to the best we can.

"We have to do it right there in that split second on the one minute 20 seconds. We have to make a decision.

"The three judges were unanimous. It wasn’t down to me. It was unanimous and I agreed."

*Strictly Come Dancing returns on Saturday 19th October at 6.40pm with the results show on Sunday 20th October at 7.15pm on BBC One
description: Dianne Buswell spoke of her upset with the Strictly Come Dancing judges in her first TV interview with evicted Dev Griffin
